intro: Idothea marginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Idothea marginata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
